intro: Jacobaea analoga, commonly known as the common ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has dark green, serrated leaves and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas. It contains pyrrolizidine alkaloids, which are toxic to livestock and can cause liver damage. Due to its toxicity, it is considered a noxious weed in many regions.
